lines.text: Wouldst fling a hoof with me?
Come on, Miss Diane, strut your stuff!
Mother - how vicious!
You look sweet, darling! If I do say it - I picked myself some snappy parents!
I'm going to the Yacht Club. See you at dawn!
Hurrah for Giraffes and other Long Neckers. Will call for you. Freddie
Ann, be cautious. A rich man wants his money's worth!
I know, Mother - you've preached the formula often enough! Beauty - and - purity! But after I'm married, won't I have a fling!
Li'l hot baby want a cool li'l sip?
Here for long, Mr. Blaine?
I wasn't - but I am. And don't call me Mr. Blaine.
All right - Ben. And I'm known as - Diana the Dangerous!
Ben - can't you see the yearning in my innocent blue eyes?
Do you think a friendly kiss would shock the little stranger?
Diana's too free - in public. When it comes to marriage, men are still old-fashioned.
You want to taste all of life - don't you?
Yes - all! I want to hold out my hands and catch it - like the sunlight.
Methinks there's dirty work at the cross-roads tonight!
I was just thinking - a man has to be sure of the girl he marries...
I know how you must feel, Ben - about girls who are daring - and free with their - love - I know I seem stupid - I can't be daring - and free with men - I'm not a 'modern'...
